story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Vietnam, there was a kind and curious little boy named Minh. Minh loved to explore the world around him, and he was always asking his mother questions about the things he saw and experienced.

One day, Minh's mother told him a story about a magical creature that lived in the forest near their village. This creature was called the " Linh Hoang," and it was said to have the power to grant wishes to those who were pure of heart and good of deed.

Minh was fascinated by the story and begged his mother to take him to the forest to find the Linh Hoang. At first, his mother was hesitant, worried about the dangers that lurked in the forest. But Minh was so determined and promised to be very careful, so his mother finally agreed.

Together, they set out on their journey early the next morning. They walked for hours, deeper and deeper into the forest, until they came upon a clearing. In the center of the clearing was a small pond, and sitting on a rock next to the pond was the Linh Hoang.

Minh's eyes widened with wonder as he gazed upon the creature. It was small and delicate, with shimmering golden scales and a long, thin tail. Its wings were so transparent that they seemed to be made of air, and its eyes sparkled with a wisdom beyond its years.

Minh approached the Linh Hoang slowly, not wanting to scare it away. When he was close enough, he bowed respectfully and asked, "Oh, wise and magical Linh Hoang, can you grant me a wish?"

The Linh Hoang regarded Minh with kind eyes and asked, "What is your wish, little one?"

Minh thought for a moment before answering. "I wish for my mother and I to be happy and healthy, and for our village to be safe and prosperous."

The Linh Hoang smiled and nodded. "Your wish is granted, little one. May you and your mother always be blessed with joy and good fortune."

And with that, the Linh Hoang disappeared in a flash of light, leaving Minh and his mother to return to their village.

From that day on, Minh and his mother lived happily and healthily, and their village flourished. Minh never forgot the lesson he learned that day in the forest: that the greatest wish of all is for the happiness and well-being of those we love.

And with that, my little one, it's time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that you are loved and cherished more than anything in this world. Goodnight.
